meanings.definition: The act of applying something again.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the farmer made a reapplication of fertilizer to his crops.
meanings.sent2: She submitted a reapplication for the job after making some improvements to her resume.
meanings.sent3: The reapplication of sunscreen was necessary to avoid getting sunburned.
meanings.sent4: Just like a painter adding a second coat of paint, the reapplication of the sealant ensured a strong bond.
meanings.sent5: The reapplication of the bandage helped the wound heal faster.

meanings.definition: The process of reusing or reapplying for something.
meanings.sent1: The reapplication of the coupon allowed her to get a discount on her purchase.
meanings.sent2: He decided to make a reapplication for the scholarship after missing the deadline the first time.
meanings.sent3: The reapplication of the password was necessary after forgetting it for the third time.
meanings.sent4: Just like a student retaking a test, the reapplication for the loan required careful preparation.
meanings.sent5: The reapplication of the paint on the walls gave the room a fresh look.
